p: 1900–1901, REED, CARROLL, LAZEAR and AGRAMONTE (“Yellow Fever Commission”): first evidence of the transmission of the YF agent by arthropods ( Aedes aegypti – experimental mosquitoes were supplied by C. Finlay – cf. 1881) to a susceptible man; during the experiments J. Lazear infected himself unintentionally and died (first fatal laboratory infection with a virus); beginnings of arbovirology.
